Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit in judgement of murders - "crossing live into the moral world" by dragging the attorney before court. The Dutch react with a homily on the vagaries of life and with incredulity at the weirdly foreign notion that privileged first-world opinions need be entertained.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are missing and only body parts and a feeding tornado made of bone and dust are present. When the dust group tries to make their way back to safety, the monster catches up to them and tries to feed on them. Can they fend off the bone eating beast?
Some nice sand biking chase sequences.
Some good

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..even the worst movie.

I felt my eyes close and the people around me bobbing and weaving.

To answer your question - yes - it is a really great movie. I guess you kind of got what you wanted.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>
